channel.title: Strange location for a unicorn
channel.description:
I was mining and I saw this:
Also: where is best place to mine coal on a non members world.
[img]http://u.ultb.net/1225957506.png[/img]
Is that the right place for it to be?

item.title: Strange location for a unicorn
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

sanga282:

i thought i was up-to-date with this modern lingo but apparently not. WTF is certing / certers

It’s from RSC. Instead of withdrawing noted items, you have to take your items to a “certer” to have them noted.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange location for a unicorn
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:241523”][quote author=hat trix link=topic=317874.msg2542487#msg2542487 date=1227064293]

Don’t unicorns and bears spawn just a little south of there?
[/quote]Yep, I used to kill them there.

If you saw a unicorn in varrock sewer, that’d be strange. Seeing a unicorn in a mining pit not far from where they spawn means they actually moved from the starting position slightly more than usual!

me and a couple of other 30 people made bob the cat walk inside the wizards tower south of draynor from faladore, idk if it still works now, but npcs wouldnt walk over top of you as long as you were standing in a place before they were, and bob the cat walked anywhere 0.0

You used to be able to do that with any NPC. They would try not to leave their designated area, but you could coax them out of it with 3 people blocking all other tiles (or I believe 1 person if you were really good).

People used to do it with bankers at draynor, coax them nearer the certers so certing was faster.[/quote]
i thought i was up-to-date with this modern lingo but apparently not. WTF is certing / certers

Read full topic

item.title: Strange location for a unicorn
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:13, topic:241523”][quote author=magma link=topic=317874.msg2526630#msg2526630 date=1226228044]

Don’t unicorns and bears spawn just a little south of there?
[/quote]Yep, I used to kill them there.

If you saw a unicorn in varrock sewer, that’d be strange. Seeing a unicorn in a mining pit not far from where they spawn means they actually moved from the starting position slightly more than usual!

me and a couple of other 30 people made bob the cat walk inside the wizards tower south of draynor from faladore, idk if it still works now, but npcs wouldnt walk over top of you as long as you were standing in a place before they were, and bob the cat walked anywhere 0.0[/quote]

You used to be able to do that with any NPC. They would try not to leave their designated area, but you could coax them out of it with 3 people blocking all other tiles (or I believe 1 person if you were really good).

People used to do it with bankers at draynor, coax them nearer the certers so certing was faster.

Read full topic

Don’t unicorns and bears spawn just a little south of there?
[/quote]Yep, I used to kill them there.

If you saw a unicorn in varrock sewer, that’d be strange. Seeing a unicorn in a mining pit not far from where they spawn means they actually moved from the starting position slightly more than usual![/quote]

me and a couple of other 30 people made bob the cat walk inside the wizards tower south of draynor from faladore, idk if it still works now, but npcs wouldnt walk over top of you as long as you were standing in a place before they were, and bob the cat walked anywhere 0.0

item.title: Strange location for a unicorn
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

PaulT:

NPC’s still don’t leave their assigned area, however coerced. It would be a bug if the unicorn actually left it’s range, but I dunno if it did, or if there is such a bug. There are plenty of bugs in RS. Now find one you can exploit and you’re getting somewhere.

a secret underground unicorn fighting ring with bets 20% cut etc. Done.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange location for a unicorn
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

NPC’s still don’t leave their assigned area, however coerced. It would be a bug if the unicorn actually left it’s range, but I dunno if it did, or if there is such a bug. There are plenty of bugs in RS. Now find one you can exploit and you’re getting somewhere.

Read full topic

It has legs, Hence it can walk
